title: Subordinating Conjunctions: Complex Sentences
objectives: Understand Conjunctions Subordinating at Beginner level
Apply Conjunctions Subordinating in real conversations

vocabulary.definition: Gives a reason. Example: I stayed home because it rained.
Shows contrast. Example: Although it was cold, we went out.
Indicates time. Example: Call me when you arrive.
Shows condition. Example: If it rains, we stay inside.
Shows simultaneous actions. Example: She listened while he spoke.

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Conjunctions Subordinating.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Conjunctions Subordinating at the Beginner level.
tips: Practice Conjunctions Subordinating daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct word: I stay home ____ it rains.
She didn't go to the party ____ she was sick.
Explain why you like or dislike a hobby using a subordinating conjunction.

culturalNote: Subordinating conjunctions are essential in American English for expressing complex ideas and detailed reasoning in speech and writing.
